greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(x^4) / phi(x) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/2) * eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4) * eta(q^8)^2 / eta(q^2)^5 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (16 t)) = 8^(-1/2) * g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is g.f. for A210030.
a(n) = (-1)^n * A187154(n). Convolution inverse of A208589.
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[x^(-1/2) * EllipticTheta[2, 0, x^2] / (2*EllipticTheta[3, 0, x]), {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 17 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^8 + A)^2 / eta(x^2 + A)^5, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 16 2012
